flights.Key_Evidence: • First request to taxi to gate E12 immediately after landing, indicating aircraft was ready to proceed. | • Pilot explicitly states they have been waiting for ramp crew and can only proceed now that the crew is arriving – direct evidence of ramp-crew unavailability. | • Confirms gate was physically open; delay not caused by late departure or gate occupation, pointing to lack of ramp personnel as root cause. | • Long ground hold despite free gate further supports that only missing ramp crew prevented parking.

Evidence_Details.message: Ground, Skywest 4697 for Echo 12.

Evidence_Details.message: Ground, Skywest 4697, looks like our ground crew is coming out, so we should be entering now.
Evidence_Details.relevance: Pilot explicitly states they have been waiting for ramp crew and can only proceed now that the crew is arriving – direct evidence of ramp-crew unavailability.

Evidence_Details.message: Previous flight UAL2018 pushed at 08:17 (8 min EARLY). Gate available long before SKW4697 landed.
Evidence_Details.relevance: Confirms gate was physically open; delay not caused by late departure or gate occupation, pointing to lack of ramp personnel as root cause.

Evidence_Details.message: Taxi-in time 44 min with no gate conflict and 50 min early arrival.
Evidence_Details.relevance: Long ground hold despite free gate further supports that only missing ramp crew prevented parking.

flights.Key_Evidence: • Meets the rule-based threshold for the Early Arrival classification and no higher-priority (FAA, Mechanical, Late Departure, etc.) evidence was found. | • Confirms the aircraft was still maneuvering to the gate over 50 minutes after landing, illustrating the long taxi-in that followed its early arrival rather than a gate-blocked situation. | • Shows general F-pier alleyway congestion affecting inbound movements; no transcript evidence of late departure, tow delay, mechanical, or other specific root cause for gate F8.

flights.Key_Evidence: • Meets ≥15-minute early-arrival threshold; no later-than-scheduled departure at gate F18, so schedule variance is the only verified driver. | • Shows aircraft already taxiing after early landing; no indications of FAA gate hold, mechanical, ramp-crew, or late-departure issues for gate F18. | • Confirms no late-departure or tow-off event blocking the gate; reinforces that the delay stems from arriving far ahead of schedule rather than an operational blockage.

flights.Key_Evidence: • Directly states that no ramp crew was available at the assigned gate (E12) for flight 5217 immediately after landing. | • Ground controller advising the flight that personnel are still on their way, reinforcing that ramp staff were not yet present. | • Ramp channel confirms staffing shortage and that only one ramper is available, further supporting ramp crew unavailability as root cause. | • Shows gate E12 was physically available; therefore delay is not due to late departure or gate occupancy but operational staffing (ramp).

Evidence_Details.message: Cessna 5217, no ramp crew at Echo 12.
Evidence_Details.relevance: Directly states that no ramp crew was available at the assigned gate (E12) for flight 5217 immediately after landing.

Evidence_Details.message: They'll still be here shortly, so maybe the next 5 minutes.
Evidence_Details.relevance: Ground controller advising the flight that personnel are still on their way, reinforcing that ramp staff were not yet present.

Evidence_Details.message: "…we got one ramper, but he's used to chocks, waiting on football, but we okay here for a bit?"
Evidence_Details.relevance: Ramp channel confirms staffing shortage and that only one ramper is available, further supporting ramp crew unavailability as root cause.

Evidence_Details.message: Previous flight SKW5435 pushed at 13:12 (3 min early) leaving gate free 1 h 44 min before SKW5217 landed.
Evidence_Details.relevance: Shows gate E12 was physically available; therefore delay is not due to late departure or gate occupancy but operational staffing (ramp).

flights.Key_Evidence: • Meets the Early Arrival threshold and is the only verified schedule-based driver. | • Immediately after landing the aircraft is instructed to hold, indicating the gate/ramp was not ready to accept the flight well ahead of its scheduled time. | • Confirms no late-departure or tow-off event—gate was technically free, reinforcing that the delay stems from the aircraft’s very early arrival rather than an operational blockage.

flights.Key_Evidence: • Meets the pure schedule-variance threshold for Early Arrival and triggers search for compound causes. | • Confirms the previous flight assigned to gate F19 (UAL1757) was still on the ramp area well after UAL2123 had landed, showing the gate was legitimately in use rather than late departing ≥15 min. | • Verifies prior aircraft was not a late departure (delay <15 min) and therefore the gate conflict was created by UAL2123’s early arrival, not by an operational delay of the outbound flight.

flights.Key_Evidence: • Confirms an aircraft is in the process of being pushed/towed off gate F13 just before UAL1129 lands – gate still occupied. | • Tow operation for blocking aircraft (flight 285) experiencing problems with the tug – indicates delayed tow-off. | • Explicitly states the tow tractor is disabled while trying to move the blocking aircraft – root cause of extended gate occupancy. | • Directly ties the broken pushback tug to gate F13, confirming mechanical tow delay is at UAL1129’s assigned gate. | • Controller explains that all inbound traffic (including UAL1129) is waiting until the aircraft is towed out – shows delay propagation.

Evidence_Details.message: Okay, United 1757, is that company we're following pushing off Foxtrot 13? Yep.
Evidence_Details.relevance: Confirms an aircraft is in the process of being pushed/towed off gate F13 just before UAL1129 lands – gate still occupied.

Evidence_Details.message: San Bernardino 285, maybe we're having issues with the tug, could be a few minutes, we'll let you know.
Evidence_Details.relevance: Tow operation for blocking aircraft (flight 285) experiencing problems with the tug – indicates delayed tow-off.

Evidence_Details.message: Ground Air 285, it looks like it's going to be a few minutes, we've got nine people out here running around the tow tractor who looks disabled.
Evidence_Details.relevance: Explicitly states the tow tractor is disabled while trying to move the blocking aircraft – root cause of extended gate occupancy.

Evidence_Details.message: Ops 38, what's up? The broken pushback here on Alpha being gate Foxtrot 13, the mechanics just arrived.
Evidence_Details.relevance: Directly ties the broken pushback tug to gate F13, confirming mechanical tow delay is at UAL1129’s assigned gate.

Evidence_Details.message: "...once the target sticks or gets on us and towed out, then I could get everybody moving, but we've got some inbound and everybody's waiting to go to gate..."
Evidence_Details.relevance: Controller explains that all inbound traffic (including UAL1129) is waiting until the aircraft is towed out – shows delay propagation.
